intro: Tristania bilocularis, commonly known as the two-chambered tristania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Tristania bilocularis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
